sdumitriu - (00:00): gvallarelli, why do people live?  
gvallarelli - (00:00): sdumitriu, it's a difficult question  
gvallarelli - (00:00): but I'll try  
gvallarelli - (00:01): people live because they love life  
gvallarelli - (00:01): and all the things that are life related  
sdumitriu - (00:01): Good answer  
vmassol - (00:01): because killing oneself is so hard… :)  
gvallarelli - (00:01): like emotions  
vmassol - (00:01): so you're lef with living and then you need to find a reason to live....  
vmassol - (00:02): s/lef/left/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:02): Because the grass couldn't think of a better mechanism to prevent the trees from taking over.  
vmassol - (00:02): ok guys, night time for me!  
sdumitriu - (00:02): Goodnight vmassol  
vmassol - (00:02): have some good discussions  
vmassol - (00:02): nn  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:03): Night.  
gvallarelli - (00:03): I think that something about reason it's wired inside our brain  
gvallarelli - (00:03): all we make, we make for some reason  
gvallarelli - (00:03): it's inside us  
gvallarelli - (00:03): when we have no answer we invented one  
gvallarelli - (00:03): like the idea of God

gvallarelli - (00:03): about goal  
gvallarelli - (00:04): one person have to set goals  
gvallarelli - (00:04): in his life  
gvallarelli - (00:04): CalebJamesDeLisl,  what do you think?  
sdumitriu - (00:04): What do you value most, net sum at the end, or everyday happyness?  
gvallarelli - (00:04): the long distance result  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:04): Goals, I have a few long term projects.  
gvallarelli - (00:05): sdumitriu, but I have intermediate release  
gvallarelli - (00:05): :D  
gvallarelli - (00:05): for example I have one specific goal in my life  
gvallarelli - (00:05): Decide what to do after my bachelor degree in C.S.  
DV\_ joined #xwiki at 00:06  
gvallarelli - (00:06): work or continue to study  
sdumitriu - (00:06): Do both  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:06): What effect does that goal have on the world when we are all dust?  
sdumitriu - (00:06): My point exactly  
sdumitriu - (00:07): Think Big  
sdumitriu - (00:07): No, thing HUGE  
gvallarelli - (00:07): for example  
sdumitriu - (00:07): Do you know how many stars are there in our universe?  
gvallarelli - (00:07): I want to participate to GSoC for one specific reason  
sdumitriu - (00:07): Life doesn't matter  
gvallarelli - (00:07): enrich my curriculum vitae so I can choose a better job position later  
sdumitriu - (00:08): So, as long as it doesn't matter, make the most of the present  
gvallarelli - (00:08): and also understand more about development  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:08): Why the better job?  
gvallarelli - (00:08): In italy there are not a lot of jobs  
gvallarelli - (00:08): in IT  
gvallarelli - (00:08): jobs in IT are about consultancy about SAP  
sdumitriu - (00:08): Jobs suck  
gvallarelli - (00:08): I don't want to be a consultant  
sdumitriu - (00:09): Do like me, get real good and then get paid to do what you like  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:09): Some goals require a good job, others do not. I think you need to start from the long term goals and work back.  
gvallarelli - (00:10): sdumitriu, so you say to me that I have to change country  
gvallarelli - (00:10): :D  
sdumitriu - (00:10): Plus, in several years the best of IT won't be regular jobs  
sdumitriu - (00:10): The open source way is moving forward into mainstream acceptance  
gvallarelli - (00:10): yep  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:10): I suppose now is a good time to plug the tao te ching.  
sdumitriu - (00:11): The IBM way of working in IT is not the ultimate goal anymore  
gvallarelli - (00:13): for me a good job means that I can work with something that I don't know  
sdumitriu - (00:13): Interesting fact, Apple is going to become richer than MS  
sdumitriu - (00:13): In a couple of months  
gvallarelli - (00:13): so I think I have to change my job every 2 years  
gvallarelli - (00:13): but It's more challenging :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:14): MS must have a lot of liabilities on their balance sheet.  
gvallarelli - (00:14): Google could kill Apple  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:14): s/Apple/Microsoft  
gvallarelli - (00:15): well  
gvallarelli - (00:15): I'm a little tired  
gvallarelli - (00:15): so in conclusion  
gvallarelli - (00:15): Caleb I'll say to you the last thig  
gvallarelli - (00:15): before I go to bed  
gvallarelli - (00:15): :D

gvallarelli - (00:16): there are a lot of  things that could interest you in this world  
gvallarelli - (00:16): but you don't even know what these things are  
gvallarelli - (00:17): the best way to discover, is to try  
gvallarelli - (00:17): :)  
gvallarelli - (00:17): so don't be afraid to try  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:17): My last comment to you gvallarelli is that you should make goals which are only measurable after you have passed on.  
gvallarelli - (00:17): ok

gvallarelli - (00:25): you

gvallarelli - (00:28): it's a challange

gvallarelli - (00:29): ahaha
